publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2212# Mr Kenneth Macintosh: New Variant CJD—That the Parliament notes the continuing prevalence of BSE in Scotland and the growing numbers of cases of new variant CJD, including at least two cases in the parliamentary constituency of Eastwood; welcomes the setting up of a national care co-ordinator and CJD advice network but acknowledges the devastating effects this disease can have on victims and their families, and believes that the Scottish Executive should give its continuing support to those families affected by this terrible disease.
S1M-2212# New Variant CJD (lodged on 12 September 2001) Alex Neil*, Karen Gillon*

S1M-2212# Mr Kenneth Macintosh: New Variant CJD—That the Parliament notes the continuing presence of BSE in Scotland and the growing numbers of cases of new variant CJD, including at least two cases in the parliamentary constituency of Eastwood; welcomes the setting up of a national care co-ordinator and CJD advice network but acknowledges the devastating effects this disease can have on victims and their families, and believes that the Scottish Executive should give its continuing support to those families affected by this terrible disease. Supported by: Alex Neil, Karen Gillon
S1M-2212# New Variant CJD (lodged on 12 September 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Irene Oldfather*
S1M-2212# New Variant CJD (lodged on 12 September 2001) Dr Sylvia Jackson*
S1M-2212# New Variant CJD (lodged on 12 September 2001) Tricia Marwick*, Michael Russell*, Rhoda Grant*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*

S1M-2212# Mr Kenneth Macintosh: New Variant CJD-That the Parliament notes the continuing presence of BSE in Scotland and the growing numbers of cases of new variant CJD, including at least two cases in the parliamentary constituency of Eastwood; welcomes the setting up of a national care co-ordinator and CJD advice network but acknowledges the devastating effects this disease can have on victims and their families, and believes that the Scottish Executive should give its continuing support to those families affected by this terrible disease. Supported by: Alex Neil, Karen Gillon, Tommy Sheridan, Irene Oldfather, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Tricia Marwick, Michael Russell, Rhoda Grant, Mr Gil Paterson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Elaine Smith*, Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-2212# New Variant CJD (lodged on 12 September 2001) Dr Elaine Murray*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-2212# New Variant CJD (lodged on 12 September 2001) Cathy Jamieson*, Karen Whitefield*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-2212# Mr Kenneth Macintosh: New Variant CJD-That the Parliament notes the continuing presence of BSE in Scotland and the growing numbers of cases of new variant CJD, including at least two cases in the parliamentary constituency of Eastwood; welcomes the setting up of a national care co-ordinator and CJD advice network but acknowledges the devastating effects this disease can have on victims and their families, and believes that the Scottish Executive should give its continuing support to those families affected by this terrible disease. Supported by: Alex Neil, Karen Gillon, Tommy Sheridan, Irene Oldfather, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Tricia Marwick, Michael Russell, Rhoda Grant, Mr Gil Paterson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Elaine Smith, Maureen Macmillan, Dr Elaine Murray, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Cathy Jamieson, Karen Whitefield, Ms Sandra White, Mr Jamie Stone
S1M-2212# New Variant CJD (lodged on 12 September 2001) Scott Barrie*
S1M-2212# New Variant CJD (lodged on 12 September 2001) Pauline McNeill*
